thread.title: 'Preacher Pimp' painting prompts protests in Middle Georgia
thread.title_full: 'Preacher Pimp' painting prompts protests in Middle Georgia - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi
title: 'Preacher Pimp' painting prompts protests in Middle Georgia
text:
MACON, Ga. (AP) â€” A panting titled "The Preacher Pimp" on display at the Tubman Museum in Macon is drawing protests from some religious leaders.
WGXA-TV reports that pastors from local churches gathered over the weekend outside the museum, demanding that the painting be taken down.
Protester Martha Smith called the painting "horrific," and said it's a disgrace to all black preachers in Macon.
The painting is by Georgia artist Alfred Conteh.
The artist told WMAZ-TV that he's not making preachers look bad, but that "preachers make preachers look bad." He said he takes issue with preachers who don't do more about poverty and other problems in their communities.
Museum Executive Director Andy Ambrose said the painting is part of a larger exhibit showcasing works of black artists with Georgia ties.
